title: Clothing label likely from the 1920's
content:
Greetings,  
I am studying a garment with this label in it and wish to identify the typeface .

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415092019im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RobinsonCo_3417.Ltd..jpg)
  
Would any one have any ideas on this. I am only at sans serif condensed, likely 1920's or a bit earlier.  
Thanks so much  
Heather
author: hezah

comments.content: Heather, in the 1920's typefaces did not work like today, where a set of computerised outlines can be moved from one medium to another with relative ease. A typeface then would merely be used for printing, practically all signs for instance would be hand-lettered. This logo was probably imput manually into the punch card for the Saurer machine (or whatever specific solution was used) and is not based on any specific typeface.
